title: Why is graduating in the top 15% of my class important in high school? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are planning on going to college after, you may lose out on scholarship money based on your class rank. Despite my gpa being just as high or higher than others applying to the same colleges as I did, my class rank caused me to lose scholarship money. Of course, if you have a smaller school, getting a higher class rank may be easier and that could be a good boost to put you into the next bracket up for academic scholarships and save you money in the future

I’m in high school and I’ve literally never heard of this. When I do work I don’t have any objective to graduation within any percentile or range, I just do the work and go the fuck home. Honestly, if it’s inportant to you, then go for it. But people often overestimate what colleges want from them and make things that are unimportant important. My brother had about a C average and never took any SATs and he still got into college. This probably doesn’t answer your question. Bleh.
